intro: Senecio keniodendron, commonly known as the Keniodendron groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are generally narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio keniodendron is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
